page.title: 04RELIGION-York Churches.
page.content: {St.Barnabas' Church}has red and orange bricks and black slates.It was built in 1904 and changed its name to St.Barnabas in 1913.There are three lancet windows and the east window is in decorated style.We have a bell on top of the west side.On top of the door there are herring-bone patterns. The foundation stone says "To the Glory of God.This stone was laid by George D.Faberson MP on 5th March 1905." Inside the church there are brick arches and wooden vaulted ceilings.At the very back there is a font. On Sunday morning we go to church at 10.00 o'clock.When we get there we put our stars on our names and go in with our friends for service.Sometimes all the{Sunday School}children have to go up to answer questions about God before we go downstairs in our groups.
